content:
"""
The error shows we're having issues with the place_entity_next_to function and reference positions.
Let's simplify our approach and place entities with explicit positioning.
"""

# First check our inventory
print(f"Starting inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")

# Craft necessary components if needed
craft_item(Prototype.IronGearWheel, quantity=5)
craft_item(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill)

# Find iron patch and move there
iron_pos = nearest(Resource.IronOre)
move_to(iron_pos)

# Place mining drill directly
drill = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerMiningDrill, position=iron_pos)
assert drill, "Failed to place mining drill"

# Get the drill's position and calculate inserter position
drill_pos = drill.position
inserter_pos = Position(x=drill_pos.x + 2, y=drill_pos.y)  # Place inserter 2 tiles to the right

# Place inserter at calculated position
move_to(inserter_pos)
inserter = place_entity(Prototype.BurnerInserter, position=inserter_pos)
assert inserter, "Failed to place inserter"

# Get coal for fuel
coal_pos = nearest(Resource.Coal)
move_to(coal_pos)
coal_collected = harvest_resource(coal_pos, quantity=50)
assert coal_collected > 0, "Failed to collect coal"

# Move back and fuel everything
move_to(drill_pos)
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, drill, quantity=10)
move_to(inserter_pos)
insert_item(Prototype.Coal, inserter, quantity=5)

print(f"Mining setup completed. Entities: {get_entities()}")
print(f"Final inventory: {inspect_inventory()}")

# Wait a moment to see if system is working
sleep(5)
